intro: Serratula lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf serratula, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in rocky or arid soils. Serratula lanceolata is known for its medicinal properties, though it can be toxic in high doses. It is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
